title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Paris

content.rendered:
Bonjour! Are you looking for rooms for rent in Paris? Check out our handy guide to the city, here. Moving to a new place can be challenging, but with the right knowledge and game plan, it can be smooth sailing, and with this detailed guide, you will easily find rooms for rent in the City of Love. So, let’s dive into the basics: average rent, top neighborhoods, and the best places to find cheap rooms for rent in Paris.

Related: 17 Best Things to Do in Paris

Getting to know Paris

Related: Roomi’s Guide For The First Time Renter

Paris, the capital city of France, is a major European city and a global hub for art, fashion, gastronomy and culture. Besides the Eiffel Tower, the city offers a plethora of other beautiful sites and monuments to complement the broad boulevards and attractive cafés. French food is extremely well-known across the globe, and some of the greatest restaurants in the world can be found in Paris. Come along for the ride as we show you all the things you need to know to enjoy the City of Love.

Finding rooms for rent in Paris

Fina A Room For Rent In Paris

Whether you’re moving to Paris for a job, moving closer to your family, or simply upgrading your home, this city won’t disappoint you! It is made up of 20 districts known as arrondissements, and all its neighborhoods offer a wide choice of furnished and unfurnished apartments. Demand for rental properties is currently outpacing supply, especially in major districts. However, finding cheap rooms for rent in Paris is not a Herculean task.

Furthermore, the city has many amenities, including world-renowned universities, and excellent hospitals and healthcare centers.

Let’s look into the best neighborhoods with cheap rooms for rent in Paris.

Related: Apartment Security Systems: Steps You Can Take As A Renter

Top neighborhoods in Paris

  • Bastille: An affordable neighborhood with a perfect mix of old and new architecture. Cheap rooms for rent in Paris can be found easily in this neighborhood. Traditional stone houses sits next to modernized apartments complete with colorful veneers.
  • Oberkampf: Among the city’s most underrated arrondissements is Oberkampf. It’s very popular with young people and partygoers. Not only does the area offer excellent links to the rest of the city, it is also the place to live if you want to party close to home.
  • Menilmontant: A hip, up-and-coming area, perfect for young professionals. It provides cheap rooms for rent in Paris with a lively ambiance to match. Today, the neighborhood is full to the brim with independent coffee shops, family-run bakeries, and speakeasy bars that are worth the hunt to find.

Average rent in Paris

University life in Paris

Paris is a popular study destination for international students, and no wonder. Here, you will experience everything in terms of culture and innovation! And we haven’t even started on the historical and architectural assets of the city. Paris is also home to some of the world’s best universities.

The top universities to check out:

  • Université PSL
  • Institut Polytechnique de Paris
  • Sorbonne University
  • Université Paris-Saclay
  • Ecole des Ponts ParisTech

Related: 7 Ways to Save Money and Make Money in College

How transit friendly is Paris?

1. Walkability

Sightseeing, and hunting for cheap rooms for rent in Paris, are easily done on foot. Truly, one can explore the entire city in only a few hours, popping into a café or two along the way.

2. Public Transportation

A good alternative to walking is public transport, usually the Metro or a bus. For around 5 Euros, you can purchase a one-day ticket. There are also weekly and monthly public transportation travel cards available.

3. Car Rentals

In the middle of Paris, traffic is extremely congested, and parking on the street is practically impossible, particularly near the Arc de Triomphe. To say the least, driving in this city can be unpredictable. The average cost of renting a car is 70 Euros per day.

4. Taxi

Taxis are extremely expensive, but they are slightly less so at night when there is less traffic. Furthermore, taxi ranks can be found near train stations, big hotels, popular attractions, and major intersections. There is a minimum fare of 6.50 Euros for all taxi rides.

Related: The Eco-Life: 5 Energy-Saving Tips for Renters

Cultural activities in Paris

1. The Eiffel Tower

The Eiffel Tower is a must-see in the City of Love! This majestic structure, which was first opened to the public on March 31, 1889, is still as spectacular now as it was back then. Moreover, it’s a great place to relax and admire French architecture after a day spent looking for rooms for rent in Paris.

2. Notre-Dame de Paris

Notre-Dame de Paris is a magnificent medieval Catholic church that literally means “Our Lady of Paris.” It’s one of the most beautiful examples of French Gothic architecture. Moreover, it has served as inspiration for artists from all over the world

3. The Louvre

The Louvre, located on the banks of the Seine, is unlike any other museum in the world. It’s the world’s largest museum and a well-known landmark in the downtown area. Definitely book your tickets to see Da Vinci’s magnificent painting of the Mona Lisa.

4. Sacre Coeur

Make a point of visiting the Sacre-Coeur Basilica. Politically, culturally, and aesthetically, it’s a very popular attraction. In fact, you can climb to the top of the Basilica to reach the highest point of the city, the Butte Montmartre.

Related: 4 Reasons Why You Should Invest In Renter’s Insurance

Shopping in Paris

The City of Love is known for its incredible shopping opportunities. It’s a shopper’s paradise, easily on a par with New York, London, and Milan. It’s the perfect pit-stop after a tough day’s search for rooms for rent in Paris – even if you only look at the window displays featuring the newest fashion trends, jewelry, cosmetics, gadgets, arts, and crafts.

Affordable products from Parisian clothing boutiques may be found in Le Marais. Further, explore the stores along Canal St-Martin or be welcomed into the ancient Palais Royal Arcades.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Paris? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we’ll help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
